text:
AWS easily allows
creation

of a scalable environment,
which is very important

for companies
like Open Classroom,

which are rapidly growing,
and it also enables

easy testing
of new services

without risking too much
as it's simple enough
to put in place.
My name is Romain Kuzniak,

Technical Supervisor for
Open Classrooms.

OpenClassrooms is a
digital learning platform

offering
courses on new technologies

and
digital transformation.

Currently there are more than one million
members on Open Classrooms
with 2.5 million unique
visitors monthly.

The platform supports
on average approximately 2,000 requests

per minute with peaks
reaching
8,000 requests per minute.

Flexibility is at the heart of
Open Classrooms,

whether for
development

but also
for all the other aspects.

We work on
functionalities

that are kept
to a minimum and that we produce

regularly
to be able to have
user feedback.

So during the development
phase,

it was quite important
for us to have

a platform which could
support us
in that effort.

In Open Classrooms,
we deploy a product

between zero and twenty
times daily.

Hence it is essential
for the platform to be

malleable and flexible
in relation to this development
phase.

During 2014,
it was apparent

that our infrastructure
no longer responded to our needs.

That could be
traffic needs,

services needs
that we wanted to put in place

and that infrastructure
could not allow,

but also
in the functionality

development phase
where constrictions arose.

In our migration
effort, we very

quickly envisaged
AWS
as supporting us.

We also chose
a partner which is Morea

who supported us and who
implemented all these migrations.

So the migration was
ultimately quite smooth.

We must always
be operational,

must always
be functional,

so availability quality
was primordial.

There was also the
platform's capacity

to withstand
peak loads
that could arise.

But also
security criteria,
that is user data which
is very important.

And this data had to be
able to be easily encrypted.

Finally there was
a global point of view.

We are
a francophone platform,

accessible
globally,

so the multi-regional
criteria was also important.

We use many
AWS services,

especially
web-oriented ones.

I consider Amazon EC2,
Amazon S3, Amazon RDS,

all of that to manage
databases

but also everything
related to screening,

load balancing and also
KMS to be able to
encrypt user data.

One of the functionalities
which was important for us,

was the option
for QA to be able to easily

test various
functionalities
that we were developing.

With our partner
Morea, we're working

to put an on-the-fly automatic
staging mechanism in place.

When the developer
changes a task's status,

that will automatically create
a staging environment

for that functionality
bound for QA.

Open Classrooms is about being
ever more innovative,
ever more successful -

And this new infrastructure
will permit Open Classrooms

to be able to reach
its goals in the future.
